intro: Sphaeralcea coccinea var. coccinea, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its bright red flowers, which are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, giving the plant its genus name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-green fruits that contain seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant plant.
